Docs.summary: Gets or sets the that specifies how the outline is painted.
Docs.value: A that specifies how the outline is painted. The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|, , |

Docs.returns: A that specifies how the outline is painted. The default is .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a collection of <xref:System.Double> values that indicate the pattern of dashes and gaps that is used to outline shapes.
Docs.value: A collection of <xref:System.Double> values that specify the pattern of dashes and gaps.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Each <xref:System.Double> in the collection specifies the length of a dash or gap relative to the <xref:System.Windows.Thickness> of the pen. For example, a value of `1` creates a dash or gap that has the same length as the thickness of the pen (a square).
The first item in the collection, which is located at index 0, specifies the length of a dash; the second item, which is located at index 1, specifies the length of a gap.
Objects with an even index value specify dashes; objects with an odd index value specify gaps.

Docs.returns: A collection of <xref:System.Double> values that specify the pattern of dashes and gaps.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This setting applies to both ends of each dash.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a enumeration value that describes the at the end of a line.
Docs.value: One of the enumeration values for . The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property has no effect if you set it on a shape that has no <xref:System.Windows.Shapes.Shape.Stroke%2A> or that has no start or end points. For example, this property has no effect if you set it on an <xref:System.Windows.Shapes.Ellipse>.

Docs.returns: One of the enumeration values for . The default is .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a enumeration value that specifies the type of join that is used at the vertices of a .
Docs.value: One of the enumeration values for

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property has no effect if you set it on an element that has no vertices, such as on a <xref:System.Windows.Shapes.Line> element.
## Examples The following example shows several different joints used at the vertices of a shape.
[!code-xml[drawingwithshapeelements#PolylineExample1](../../add/codesnippet/Xaml/drawingwithshapeelements/polylineexample.xaml#polylineexample1)]
The following illustration shows the different line joins.
![Example of line joins.](../../add/media/graphicslinejoins.png "Example of line joins.")

Docs.returns: One of the enumeration values for

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.DependencyProperty StrokeLineJoinProperty

Docs.summary: Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Shapes.Shape.StrokeLineJoin%2A> dependency property.
Docs.returns: The identifier for the <xref:System.Windows.Shapes.Shape.StrokeLineJoin%2A> dependency property.
Docs.value: The identifier for the <xref:System.Windows.Shapes.Shape.StrokeLineJoin%2A> dependency property.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a limit on the ratio of the miter length to half the <xref:System.Windows.Shapes.Shape.StrokeThickness%2A> of a element.
Docs.value: The limit on the ratio of the miter length to the <xref:System.Windows.Shapes.Shape.StrokeThickness%2A> of a element. This value is always a positive number that is greater than or equal to 1.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A miter forms a corner by beveling the ends of two joined lines.When two line segments meet at a sharp angle, the miter may extend beyond the thickness of the line that strokes the path.

Docs.returns: The limit on the ratio of the miter length to the <xref:System.Windows.Shapes.Shape.StrokeThickness%2A> of a element. This value is always a positive number that is greater than or equal to 1.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property has no effect if you set it on a shape that has no <xref:System.Windows.Shapes.Shape.Stroke%2A> or that has no start or end points. For example, this property has no effect if you set it on an <xref:System.Windows.Shapes.Ellipse>.

Docs.returns: One of the enumeration values. The default is .
